meanings.sent1: Her blunder in the math test cost her a good grade.
meanings.sent2: The politician's blunder during the speech caused a lot of embarrassment.
meanings.sent3: He made a blunder by wearing mismatched socks to the important meeting.
meanings.sent4: The blunder in the recipe turned the cake into a salty disaster.
meanings.sent5: The blunder in the play's script made the audience burst into laughter.

meanings.definition: To make a careless or stupid mistake.
meanings.sent1: I blundered by forgetting my keys at home.
meanings.sent2: She tends to blunder when she's nervous.
meanings.sent3: He blundered by spilling coffee on his white shirt before the interview.
meanings.sent4: The chef blundered the dish by adding too much salt.
meanings.sent5: The detective blundered the investigation by overlooking a crucial clue.

meanings.sent1: The student's blunder in the art class was painting outside the lines.
meanings.sent2: His blunder in the game cost his team the victory.
meanings.sent3: The blunder of wearing slippers to a formal event was quite noticeable.
meanings.sent4: The blunder in the dance routine made the performance look chaotic.
meanings.sent5: The blunder in the science experiment caused a small explosion.

meanings.sent1: The toddler blundered around the room, bumping into furniture.
meanings.sent2: She blundered through the crowd to catch the bus.
meanings.sent3: He blundered along the path, tripping over rocks.
meanings.sent4: The drunk man blundered down the street, unable to walk straight.
meanings.sent5: The robot blundered through the maze, knocking down walls in its path.
